title: Which dry fruit containing calcium? - Quora

response.answer_text: Dried fruit is just fruit from which the majority of the original water content has been removed either naturally, through sun drying, or through the use of specialized dryers or dehydrators. Some of these dry fruits are calcium rich and help increase bone density. They often contain more calcium than fresh fruits, with dried apricots supplying 72 mg, seedless raisins 73 mg, dried plums 75 mg and dried pears 61 mgs of calcium per cup. Almonds are tree nuts packing a powerful nutritious punch. Not only do almonds contain nearly 200 mg of the recommended daily dose of calcium, they also deliver a whole host of nutrients like —fibre, manganese, vitamin E, to name a few—that help build a healthy lifestyle. A member of the mulberry family, dried figs and other currants like- gooseberry, blackcurrant, prunes and dried blueberries are all citrus based dry fruits that offer a good amount of zinc and other antioxidants along with calcium. Together they contain over 240 mg of calcium per cup so when you add them to a diet rich in fruits and vegetables, you'll get the calcium you need along with other nutrients such as fibre, manganese and potassium. Almond - it has a maximum calcium content among all dry fruits. This is why even doctors and dieticians recommend to have 2–3 pieces of almonds per day. According to the research, one ounce of almonds (22 nuts) delivers almost 8% of the RDI. Additionally, Almonds provide 3 grams of fiber per ounce (28 grams) and healthy fats and protein. However, almond is an excellent source of magnesium, manganese and vitamin E if you are running deficient somehow.
